post.body: i fondly look forward to my next big thin. it's going to take a lot of exercise though.
seems to be more than that, the two pins are too fat for the sockets.
thanks, I appreciate that. Lofty comparison.
omg yeah!
YAY!
yup, the sigma 30mm is canon mount. all these lenses were bought for my Canon 350D.
we're always open to good suggestions.
mpeg streamclip. Swiss army knife for a/v files.
yes! dug out the old Powermate. works nicely.
and your wallet's too small for your fifties, and your diamond shoes are too tight?
that's the sound of opportunity
city's the best London airport for the seasoned traveller but easyjet has the budget prices.
stop work immediately!
oops, slip of the ithumbs. apols.
whatwhatwhatwhat?
i remember it well, impressive.
Guibert Englebienne, Globant CTO.
yeah, i haven't climbed regularly for about 8 years now. felt like a beginner again. come to mile end with us sometime and try it.
safe travels! nice work you did here.
i'd always go for my own load balancer. dns roundrobin doesn't give you any real control, and failover is hard. http://is.gd/bq3h
we got there early and got a pew in the front row right in front of a speaker stack. ears ringing happily.
are you in christmas already?
Francis Bacon, at the Tate.
the matias has good action but i found it hard on the wrists. I switched to apple wireless for the lighter touch. love it.
pro tip: eat first, twitter second.
yay!
ah, but it's the first thing we want you to do.
remembering to follow @mondoagogo, now that we've realised we've known each other for sixteen years.
first from the UK office then brickhouse, yahoo are shedding quality people. i'm embarrassed for them, really I am.
wishing @benward speedy employment. itotallywanttoemploy@ben-ward.co.uk
eating at a place called sushi train, where the sushi does indeed run round on a toy trainset.
oops, forgot about the swiss power sockets. my regular EU adapter isn't going to cut it.
it's snowing in geneva. envious of those unloading snowboards at baggage claim.
london luton airport security charge for plastic bags for liquids. seems a bit petty, even for a cash-strapped industry.
Going to geneva brb.
working on presentations. anyone going to the webbies night tonight?
anyone know what this guy was up to in Old St station this morning? http://www.flickr.com/photos/mbiddulph/3094606111/
for those interested, i have: Canon 28mm f/2.8 (EF), 10-22mm, 17-85mm IS, Sigma 30mm f/1.4. will do price research and write up properly.
any opinions on the re-sale value (as % of current retail price) on excellent-condition canon lenses? have some EF-S to sell soon.
Trying to decide what is my favourite thing about/on the web. The thing I couldn't do without.
trying to get my head around final cut. assuming keyboard shortcuts are the key to productive flow. manual seems good but is huge and pdf.
speaking of which, what are your albums of the year? me: M83, Fleet Foxes, Flying Lotus, Bon Iver, Andy Stott
looking forward to watching M83 in a church tonight. everyone bought Saturdays = Youth this year, right? http://is.gd/bj4X
on the stopping train from Luton to London. had forgotten how patchy transport is back from the airport in the evening.
snow delays flight.
yesterday i arrived in Geneva for a meeting. exactly three years before that, I arrived in Geneva and went to live in the alps for 4 months.
having fun in geneva learning about the airline industry.
also met someone who works on actual doppler radar.
met some guys from Globant. didn't realise how much behind-the-scenes work they do on opensocial for google and others.
dead space ate my face
pulling out of shopping just before I start screaming at dawdlers.
pitstop in islington to complete stage one of christmas shopping.
wondering why it's so hard to find a copy of the fleet foxes cd on Oxford st. everyone's sold out.
back from awesome greek dinner wtih @dajobe @blaine @designswarm and @maureen. yay!
did six hours of beginner climbing training course at Mile End this weekend. hurting mostly everywhere now.
splendid low-light results from the 5D Mark II tonight (see flickr, naturally). i love gig photography.
M83: loud and beautiful
midnight and i'm still wrapping
trying to escape the gravitational pull of london. first stop paddington, for Oxford.
whittards in administration too? is there a definitive uk retail deadpool site?
hamlet was excellent. happy birthday @designswarm!
bacon, lunch, turner, chelsea. now hamlet (minus tennant)
doing birthday prep for alex for tomorrow.
at a loose end an hour before I'm due at a pub in shoreditch. who wants a pint now?
3pm: time for breakfast.
off to islington for the last few fetch quests. perhaps a diversion to the shepherdess for a late breakfast.
got my first Dent pound coin today, so i guess they're all in circulation now. but still missing a 5, 20 and 50p for my first coin-nerd set.
borough market. south bank. somerset house.
running late for coatesmas
drinks with old friends. what a tonic.
reached holiday season at last. I don't think I've ever been as tired-to-the-bone exhausted as I've been this year. hard work is hard.
